title: Putin questions US punishing India for buying Russian oil
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin challenged heavy US pressure on India not to buy Russian fuel if the US could do so as he began a two-day state visit on Thursday (Dec 4), where he was embraced on arrival by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Gangaramaya Temple donates Rs. 30 mln to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple, Ven. Dr. Kirinde Assaji Nayaka Thera, stated that support will be extended to coordinate assistance from overseas Buddhist temples.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Northeast monsoon condition is gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: President calls for urgent action to restore agriculture, livestock, and irrigation sectors
byline: A meeting was held yesterday (04) at the Presidential Secretariat, presided by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, with the participation of officials from the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of Finance...

title: Marrikkar Mohamed Thahir takes oath as SJB National List MP
byline: Naina Thambi Marikkar Mohamed Thahir was sworn in as a Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) National List Member of Parliament before Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (05).

title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force or Ukraine’s troops will withdraw
byline: President Vladimir Putin has warned again that Ukrainian troops must withdraw from Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region or Russia will seize it, rejecting any compromise over how to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Third reading vote on 2026 Budget in Parliament today
byline: The third reading vote of the 2026 Appropriation Bill, or the 80th Budget Speech is scheduled to be held today (05) at 6 p.m., the Parliament’s Department of Communication announced.

title: Indian envoy discusses reconstruction needs with Sri Lanka’s Housing Minister after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Indian High Commissioner Santosh Jha met Sri Lanka’s Housing and Construction minister to discuss reconstruction and rehabilitation efforts following Cyclone Ditwah, which has killed 486 people so far in the island nation.

title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Akuressa
byline: The highest rainfall recorded during the past 24 hours has been reported from the Akuressa area along the Nilwala River, according to L.S. Sooriyabandara, Director of Irrigation (Hydrology & Disaster Management).

title: Congo, Rwanda leaders affirm commitment to Trump-backed peace deal
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump gathered the leaders of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda to sign a peace deal in Washington on Thursday even as fighting continued in their war-scarred region.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Man arrested for preparing forged documents in Panadura
byline: A person, who had allegedly prepared forged documents, including fake identity cards, has been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol unveil bronze statue in London to mark ‘DDLJ’ 30th Anniversary
byline: Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol traveled to London to unveil a bronze statue commemorating their iconic roles in “Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge,” marking 30 years since the Yash Raj Films blockbuster first captured audiences worldwide.

title: Putin and Modi discuss trade, peace in New Delhi summit
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi began summit talks in New Delhi on Friday, as New Delhi rolled out the red carpet for the Russian leader and Modi told him India supported peace efforts in Ukraine.

title: Netflix in exclusive talks for Warner Bros Discovery studio, streaming assets – report
byline: Netflix is in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery’s film and television studios along with its streaming assets, in a deal valued at $28 per share that could reshape the media landscape, a source told Reuters on Thursday.

title: Meta shifts some metaverse investments to AI smart glasses
byline: Meta is shifting some of its investments in the metaverse to AI glasses and wearables, hoping to capitalise on the “momentum” in that segment, a company spokesperson has said.

title: PM Harini highlights Sri Lanka’s quick recovery and digital plans after floods
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that despite the recent devastation caused by severe flooding and landslides, Sri Lanka continues to recover rapidly due to the exceptional strength and solidarity demonstrated by the people.

title: Govt to launch joint loan programme for new entrepreneurs in January - Minister
byline: A joint programme by the Ministry of Finance and the banks to provide loan facilities for new entrepreneurs is planned to be launched in January next year, Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi stated.

title: Indian medical team sets up fully operational field hospital in Mahiyanganaya
byline: A fully operational field hospital has been established in Mahiyanganaya near Kandy by an Indian medical team, providing essential trauma care, surgical capability, ambulances, and other critical medical services to flood-affected communities.

title: Train season tickets valid on SLTB buses amid disaster situation
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) announced that, due to the prevailing disaster situation in the country, passengers holding train monthly season tickets will be permitted to travel on SLTB buses.

title: Train operations on Puttalam line extended to Nattandiya
byline: The Railway Department announces that train services on the Puttalam line will now operate up to Nattandiya, following the completion of repair work necessitated by recent flooding in Sri Lanaka.

title: Sri Lanka signs USD 100M loan and USD 3M grant agreements with ADB
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka held discussions with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to mobilize a policy-based loan amounting to USD 100 million to implement the Power Sector Reforms and Financial Sustainability Program (Subprogram 2).

title: Apple appoints Meta’s Newstead as general counsel amid executive changes
byline: Apple on Thursday announced that Meta Platforms’ chief legal officer, Jennifer Newstead, will join the company as its general counsel and senior vice president.

title: Parliamentary committee calls for international cooperation to boost agri & plantation sectors
byline: International cooperation should be sought for the development of the agriculture and plantation sectors, Chair of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Environment, Agriculture and Resource Sustainability, Member of Parliament Hector Appuhamy, stated.

title: Vote on third reading of 2026 Budget underway
byline: The vote on the Third Reading of the Appropriation Bill for 2026 is currently underway in Parliament, marking the final stage of this year’s Budget process.

title: President announces relief measures for people affected by weather disaster
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that Rs. 10,500 million has already been released by the Treasury in response to the recent weather disaster in the country, and that a Rs. 50 billion supplementary estimate was submitted today (05) for the same purpose.

title: 2026 Budget passed in Parliament
byline: The Third Reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill was passed with a majority of 157 votes in Parliament, a short while ago.

title: Egypt offers sincere condolences to Sri Lanka over deadly floods
byline: Egypt has extended its sincere condolences to the government and people of Sri Lanka over the victims of the recent floods that hit the country and caused hundreds of casualties.

title: 1.7 million affected by severe weather in Sri Lanka; over 5,000 homes completely destroyed
byline: Delivering a special statement in Parliament today, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake revealed the extensive scale of destruction caused by the recent severe weather conditions across the country.

title: IMF considering $200 million emergency aid for cyclone-hit Sri Lanka
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Friday that it is considering an emergency request from Sri Lanka for about $200 million in rapid financial assistance, as the island nation struggles to recover from the sweeping devastation left by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Strict action against traders selling unsafe food in disaster-affected areas
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union of Sri Lanka (PHIU) says that strict punitive measures will be taken against traders found selling food unsuitable for human consumption in areas affected by the recent adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Red’ landslide warnings issued to several areas in five districts
byline: ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide early warnings have been issued to multiple areas in five districts by the National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO).

title: Met. Dept warns of increased rainfall on December 9, 10, and 11
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that rainfall in certain parts of the island is expected to increase on December 9, 10, and 11 due to the Northeast monsoon conditions establishing in the island.

title: Property tax will not be imposed in 2026 - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the proposed property tax will not be imposed in 2026.

title: CBSL issues circular directing banks to provide relief for disaster-affected businesses
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a new circular directing all licensed banks to provide relief measures to individuals and businesses whose income or operations have been directly affected by the current adverse conditions.

title: PM commends diplomatic community for immediate support after floods, admits continuing challenges
byline: A special briefing for the diplomatic community in Sri Lanka was held at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, chaired by Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya together with the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath.
